AVON PRODUCTS, INC. - GLENVIEW, ILLINOIS BRANCH
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN (RMP)
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Avon Products - Glenview Branch facility is a warehousing operation where various consumer products are stored.  The inventory stored includes different aerosol products, such as hair care products, shaving creams, air fresheners and insect repellants.

The aerosol products include propellants such as methyl ether, isobutane, propane, butane and difluoroethane.  The aerosol propellants are a regulated flammable mixture under the Chemical Accident Prevention Rule (Risk Management Program, 40 CFR Part 68).  This flammable mixture is the only regulated substance present at the facility in a process above a threshold quantity.

The facility is classified as a Program 1 facility under the RMP rules.  As such, it presents a minimal risk to the community.

There have been no reportable accidental releases of the regulated flammable mixture in the last five years.

Accidental releases of all materials, including the regulated flammable mixture, are prevented through the proper design, operation and maintenance of the facilities, and through the proper training of the employees.  Release prevention measures include operational procedures and employee training programs specific to the handling of flammable aerosols.

Avon maintains a written emergency management plan to respond to an accidental release or other emergency.  The plan includes procedures for employee training, employee response responsibilities, plant evacuation, and the notification of the Glenview Fire Department and other local agencies.  The plan is reviewed regularly and is updated as necessary to reflect any changes at the plant.

Avon maintains an excellent working relationship with the Glenview Fire Department.  The plant fire detection system is connected directly to the fire department to ensure a rapid response to an emergency.  In addition, the fire department conducts an annual inspection of the plant
and attends an annual plant fire drill.  Therefore, the fire department is very familiar with the operations and chemical inventory at the facility.
